person.persName: Samuel Oscar Berry (Woodford County, KY, soldier and guerilla (C.S.A.) ("One-Arm"))

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, soldier and guerrilla. Kentucky, native. Son of Samuel Oscar Berry and Elizabeth McGraw Berry. Married to Amanda C. Rose in Mercer County in June 1862. Graduated from the state normal school in Lexington, Kentucky. Teacher in Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1858. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as first sergeant from November 1, 1862, to February 28, 1863. Operated as a guerrilla (C.S.A.) with Marcellus Jerome Clarke, Henry C. Magruder, and Isaiah Coalter in Anderson and adjacent counties in 1864 and 1865. Captured by a detachment of the 2nd U.S. Infantry under the command of Major Cyrus J. Wilson in Nelson County in December 1865.
